column4: its kinda like taking a healthy crap, after you're done and flushed, there's still a bad odor
if you don't have a lot invested in your ubuntu install, its probably easiest to just re-install.
thats too much trouble to go through cause i've installed ubuntu like 15 times
then you should be good at it
:s
hey, but if i install the proprietary driver of my card will 3d be enabled?
i would think so, but i'm not 100% sure, what card again?
nvidia geforce4
but after the reinstall, the prop driver, i would imagine, it would work fine
but why is envy so bad cause the guys at #wine told me to use envy
well, the guys at wine aren't very bright apparentl
Jack_Sparrow: yeah i guess so
yeah but then WoW would crash just before it opens giving me a fatal error, but after i installed the driver from envy it didnt give me the same error
and what led you to believe this was a driver error, and not a Wine error?
:S i dunno
so if i install the driver from the repo it shopuld work after the clean install?
again, one would think so.. what model geforce card is it
geforce 4 mx something
in a terminal, "lspci" no quotes, and see how it identifies your video card
a lot of words showed up i dunno what they mean
look through there, and see how it identifies your video card.
so yes, that card is fairly old, one would imagine that restricted driver should run it fine
Jack_Sparrow: thanks for the help guys im up for a new install :-/
